page.title: 01UMBERLEIGH/CHITTLEHAMPTON
page.content: UMBERLEIGH AND AROUND. Umberleigh and around is mostly farmland, but some is just uncultivated countryside. The river TAW runs through Umberleigh. There are about 12 farms in Umberleigh and Chittlehampton. Chittlehampton is a village near Umberleigh. There is a Church of England in its square. In Chittlehampton the houses are close together. Many of the houses are built of stone and cob, origninating in the 18th century. The villages are uncommercialised and suit the tourist who wants a quiet country holiday in beautifil Devon countryside. Many of the inhabitants are involved in farming and the bed and breakfast trade. Both villages have village halls where gardens fetes,school concerts,parties and other meetings.
